comments.body: I think the undead idea deserves to be implemented eventually, but it needs to be more complicated than just a rare witch throw, it would probably deserve a structure or something, and some sort of reason why you might do it on purpose.
Great Idea, wish I had thought of it!!!
I REALLY like this idea! It is awesome!
each variant has its own king of creaking

I think there are two ways that this item could be obtained which would determine wherever or not it is renewable or not. This first is that the creaking has a small chance to drop it when a naturally generated creaking heart is broken when a creaking is active and locked on to the player as there are a limited number of creaking hearts in the world this is not renewable. The second is that the creaking has a small chance to drop whenever a naturally generated creaking heart is broken when a creaking is active and locked on to the player or when the creaking spawned from a naturally generating creaking heart despawns when the night is over. 

At the moment I am leaning to the second option as it would require less traveling from forest to forest and would prompt the player to spend more time in the pale garden biome collecting the item and brave the horrors of the creaking. However how we obtain this item should contribute to the balancing of said item.

This feature could be made simpler if the targeted entities were just petrified. By this, I mean frozen for a duration of time wherever or not the thrower is looking at them. This is still in keeping with the petrified feeling of the pale garden. However, I believe using the creaking's mechanic for this item would be far more interesting as it would add a level of depth and skill when using this item.
The creaking really needs a drop.

In response to the comment which consists of several no's. I intended the drop to only be obtained from breaking natural spawning creaking hearts and dropped from the corresponding naturally spawning creaking. My current idea is that this drop is not farmable, Although I am not opposed to it changing if someone comes up with a way of making it renewable yet balanced. (Maybe you could only get it from the first creaking that spawns from a player crafted heart?) I appreciate your feedback.

From the creator of this post.

Yes I imagine so. Also I feel that for the drop to get actual use, instead of the the low dropping item, as I had originally intended. I think considering the rarity and size of the biome, the drop-rate will need to be increased as there is a very high chance that you don't get any from visiting this biome. What do you think?

I recently made a post about a pale bark dropping from creakings (Pale Bark and Pale Lillys). My pale bark concept had it function as an alternative to logs in making charcoal with the addition of being used as a potion ingredient for a unique potion.

But I believe your idea with a bark item, being used in decorating wood blocks, is better potential for this kind of item. Maybe if this item had all the functionalities we came up with for a bark item it could be an intresting and good drop for the creakings.

If I may suggest some edits for your post maybe you could call your post Creaking Bark Mob Drop to attract attention, and that you could work up some ideas how your bark decoration mechanics could work.

Your idea could revolutionize item utility for new mob loot.

<Wolfhawk>

I think this is a really cool idea, one thing I suggest changing though is maybe renaming it. Gloom Caps could be a more smooth running name.

<Wolfhawk>

Awesome Idea - I've seen this mentioned around everywhere and if mre people knew there was a vote I'm sure they would vote for it. 

This adds to the Creaky-ness and doubles down on the feeling that you need to watch them or they will watch you!
I think it should pulse and make noise, but it's not a heartbeat. The creaking is an entirely different form of life, regardless of the name of the block.

This is a great idea. An alternative way to get players down on the ground could be that any leaves within a range - say 20 blocks - of an active creaking heart would allow players to fall through them. Essentially you'd be bouncing along from tree to tree, then fall right through near a tree with a creaking guarding it.

do both, mojang. if it cant take the floor out from under u cuz its nots leaves then it burrows into the tree and appears right underneath you and claps you for extra damage, which cant be stopped by staring at you while its coming up. the attack also yeets you upwards and backwards, so the fall damage could kill anyone who isnt at least full diamond, to make the creaking give cheaters their karma. maybe im just mad about losing to my friend in ssbu, though.

Heres a translation for this good idea incase others dont speak the language but wish to read it.

A pale village may spawn in the Pale Garden. It will be built from pale wood and cobblestone. 
It may have its own loot in chests. Temples similar to the jungle temple may also spawn in the Pale Garden.
yes just yes

In bedrock edition, this already happens, as players will receive knockback, and while they won't take damage, the damage cooldown still happens. In java, players are unaffected, but really think they should!

Yes! I think the concern is that they would be annoying to get pummeled by, but for them to hardly even register takes the fun out of snowball fights. A player won't even notice that you're throwing snowballs at them if their back is turned!
I think they removed this on 1.9  :(
I've wanted an ender-man head for a long time for this exact reason!
Well technically all the mob heads get a little bigger (excluding the ender dragon) when you put them on so I wouldn't be surprised if the Creaking head got a lot bigger. ;)

I think this could be implemented only if there is some in-game hint to the explanation why.

Maybe mobs could simply have reduced sight radius, due to fog, excluding mobs with good sight (Such as all creakings, cats, and other such mobs.).

This would help players to navigate during a fight with many creakings. Currently hostile mobs like zombies, skeletons, spiders, and the infamous creepers tend to get in the way and make it far more difficult then it needs to be for inexperienced players.).

I agree with this idea (OP's). Other mobs shouldnt even spawn in the Pale Garden in the first place imo. they're too much of a distraction and the 2-fold idea you present would work really well. Solves the distraction problem and also provides a safe haven (although with another type of risk) for players running away from regular mobs. Voted!
yes, friend creaking that protects you and has hp so he can die. or brewed into a potion of climbing (what do u think it is?) no explanation needed.

I think this could add more diversity of wildlife to the pale gardens, they would need to spawn in pond like garden structures or natural ponds, prehaps with lilly pads.

The way this frog should be diffrent, is a pale pink frog, I believe this would make sense too seeing that there are frogs in real life that are white with other color tints reflecting off of them.

The froglight could be a silver pink color, prehaps called the Pale Froglight or Abalone Froglight. These are the best names I can come up with, I doubt eithervname will be official.
yes, abalone froglight. the forg itself could be translucent like glass frogs from real life.
yes, do both. make the mining fatigue last for like 30 secs

The ability to disarm mobs would be fun for two reasons: I like the idea of attacks having different results when they hit a mob's hitbox in different places, and it would allow the whip to function as a tool for late-game players who might want a mob to hold a certain item.

It could be comparable to the mace or trident, but that use as a tool would make it worthwhile for most players (compared to the mace, which might as well be a gimmick in servers without frequent pvp)

It could be crafted from drops from a future mob boss. Using more of the item would craft a whip with longer reach, and it should be able to receive most sword enchantments. It being tied to a boss would mean it could be named something more fantastical than "whip" too.
Nice, and have a secret achievement called flowerest powerest where you collect a stack of each flower
It sounds cool to have elemental vertons of the blaze
I think it would spawn in caves when it,s is storming

The one problem is that electricity isn't really seen as an element in fantasy settings. It's usually seen as a part of air, which is already covered with the breeze.

On the other hand... what if there were more than four elemental mobs?
Cool.

The problem with this idea is that resin is much easier to get than you might assume. Is true that this might be balanced if players go to the pale gardens every time they want resin. But most players will go to the pale gardens once and grab just one heart of resin, then a bunch of wood and saplings. This is possible to do without even letting the sun set (assuming your lucky), then they go back to base and create a safe environment and place the heart there. Now you get infinite resin without any danger.

I would suggest you make coating an item in resin a less powerful option, like perhaps instead of making your amor more durable it reduces knock back, but it breaks vary fast. This would be useful but not so useful that it's overpowered.
If you coat all your armor in resin then won't everybody's armor look the same? It would kinda ruin the point or armor trims and all personalization.
how to fix this: simply make it so you surround your armor in resin peices in a crafting table
I don't think this is really worth adding.
Nice. I agree fully with these changes
Add a new fish... CAVE FISH

No.

For one thing, healing ISN'T that slow.

for another, there should be some level of difficulty with defeating high-level mobs. Otherwise, there's no point.

Yeah, as a Bedrocker (well, Pocket Player, but same dif), I always watch YouTube videos of Java players with envy, watching them regenerate health so quickly. Equality across the platforms sounds like a good idea!

You mean like they poke you the same way a cactus does?

(Great idea! You have my vote!)
Yes, the damage would be like how it works with cacti.
Could you define panorama please?

Hmm, I thought panorama was the right word, But panorama means the main screen png of minecraft. The one which shows to the player the update theme. Every update, and for now, including drops, changes that png.
yeah they really need to do it

Oh okey that makes sense. Yes I was wondering why we still have the trial chamber "panorama", hopefully it changes soon.

ps. My dictionary defines it as an unbroken view of your surroundings, so yeah I guess it works.

The newest snapshot updated the panorama to the pale gardens, so this post has been answered!

Also on the snapshot page it did use the word "panorama" so yes you were using the right term.
